website_summaries.verdict: The Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper has evidently presented an above-average performance, based on the numerous positive feedback from users. A lot of runners liked that shoe was adaptable to different conditions, while some were happy with the comfort and convenience it provided. Overall, the GOrun Razor 3 Hyper is worth the purchase; despite some criticisms on its construction, the majority are satisfied and proud that the shoe exceeded their expectations.
pros: Many runners praised the responsiveness and energy return of the Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper
The shoe contributed to an improved speed, according to numerous users
Others attested that it was perfect for running in marathons
The shoe was comfortable enough to be worn daily, several reviewers said
A lot of purchasers found the GOrun Razor 3 Hyper to be affordable
The minimal weight of the shoe was appreciated by most of the users
The durability of the shoe was apparent to many wearers
Some reviewers claimed the Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper was a versatile shoe, as it performed well in both fast and slow runs
cons: Some buyers were disappointed by the limited color options of the shoe
Meanwhile, others thought that the “Speed” print was tacky
A few wearers have found the GOrun Razor 3 Hyper to be too narrow
A couple of reviewers disliked that the shoe needed a break-in period, as they developed blisters during their early runs

customer_reviews.title: Live your life one quarter mile at a time!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is all about going fast. As soon as I got them out of the box I put them on for a stroll around the neighborhood. Got pulled over by a cop for speeding in a school zone. I definitely feel like the ticket was worth it. Only get these if you want to live your life too fast too furious. Just be careful running and taking corners or you will end up like Paul Walker.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Kleaving

customer_reviews.title: Far too soft for me
customer_reviews.text: I returned these because the mid sole was way to soft for me. I'm a 161 lb 6' 1" marathon runner who likes a firm mid sole (I usually use NB). I liked the fit of these but the mid sole is ridiculously soft. I only walked in the house on the wood floor and the heels were almost bottoming out. To be fair, I am a mid foot striker and maybe they would be different on a run but I was worried about turning an ankle such was the softness of the ride. Size 11.5 fit true, uppers felt good, not too tight. The shoe is unbelievably light, I mean like ultra light racing shoes.
customer_reviews.author: El Presidente

customer_reviews.title: I got what I orderred
customer_reviews.text: They run a bit small, feel great for running. Next pair I will order 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dobbel

customer_reviews.title: light weight, supportive, and just what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.text: When looking to replace my older Saucony Men's Type A8 Sneaker, White/Black/Citron, 10 M US, I was shocked to discover they were no longer being sold. So, I scoured the internet and found these shoes. I was skeptical at first, as I really loved my Sauconys. By the time I was in the second stride of the first run with these shoes, I knew I had made the right decision. I'm looking forward to getting many more runs out of them. They are just as lightweight and comfortable as my Sauconys. However, I appreciate the extra support they provide my feet.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So wish these shoes had a better fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size 5.5 (my usual size) in preparation for my upcoming marathon. For my test run I went out for a 21 mile run. I definitely liked the feel of the cushioning/springy feel in the heel but the toe width is too tight. Its odd that I did not feel the shoe tight while walking but as I put in more miles while running , the small toes seem to feel more tight and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good but they need taller toe boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light but the toe box is not very tall so you may have toenail issues if you are a long distance runner, medium distance <10 miles you’ll just wear holes in your new sox. I had to make sure that I not only clip my toenails very short but I have to file the edges so they are dull. I’ve been running in Skechers GoRuns for years, I started wearing them when Meb started racing in them, however long ago that was. These are tighter than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Moebetta

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, roomy toe box, not sure on the performance effect
customer_reviews.text: So I love the shoes. I love wider toe boxes so those are good for me. I also love the cushion - especially for long runs. I cannot say that I am running faster because of the shoes like some others claim in reviews. However, the cushioning is good and it enables me to go for longer runs and thus improve my performance
customer_reviews.author: Lunchtimerunner

customer_reviews.title: Vow ... cloud 9
customer_reviews.text: Vow ... I did not expect such a good product from Skechers ... it is weightless ..
customer_reviews.author: shankar datta

customer_reviews.title: Not A Durable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: One day of running and you can see the pics. These are poorly made. The soles are made of styrofoam. Unless your going to just wear these around the house, don’t bother. I would ask for my money back but as you can tell after one day of exercise, they’re already worn. I will not buy another pair of sketchers.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit true to size
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed. I read so many reviews on these shoes to make sure I was making the right choice. They said they run true to size, however the pair I received did not at all. I would have to go up at least one whole size for these shoes to fit me properly, like the way my other running shoes fit (Hoka, Nike, Brooks). Aside from sizing, the pair I purchased was $48 for a women's size 8. To go up to a size 9 it is $129... Did I purchase a defective shoe?!
customer_reviews.author: cross-fit

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to run on treadmills as I do that several times per week and don't like thick soled shoes. These shoes are one of the very best light weight shoes I have ever owned. I have run on the roads and treadmill and really like them. I no longer race and since I am 68 and do more jogging than running I did not think a racing flat would work that well for me but these are great. I have probably put 300 or more miles on these and they still feel like they did our of the box. It is a shame that running shoe stores have over looked Sketchers performance series shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gass

customer_reviews.title: Great Light weight shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are very light but have plenty of cushion and bounce. I have used them for several runs of 5 - 10 miles but would feel comfortable using them for longer miles. I will be running a 1/2 in them in less then a month and I have high expectations for the shoes performance
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Nice Light Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Skechers and I’m pleasantly surprised. I usually run in zero drop shoes but was looking for something with a small drop after an Achilles injury. These are 4 mm drop, with enough cushioning to be comfortable but still firm enough to not feel like you’re running on pillows. For me, my usual size was slightly large but not enough that I wanted to deal with exchanging them, but buying again I would try half a size down.
customer_reviews.author: LemonsEveryWEek

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not made to last
customer_reviews.text: The outsides of the soles pushed my ankles in, they pretty much always hurt my ankles a little. I guess I'm not actually sad they completely wore out after only 10 weeks. I won't be buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grubb

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes yet!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a great buy. I have never spent this much on shoes before so it was a tough decision. I ask myself now what I was waiting for. These are some of the most comfortable, lightweight shoes I have ever worn. Definitely makes running a more pleasurable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Sensenig

customer_reviews.title: These things make me fast!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW...these things are awesome! This is my second pair, I was able to get 450 miles out of the first pair. The rubber got destroyed after about 300 miles, but they still felt great...I finally retired them at 450, probably could have kept going. Great for tempo work; super light and responsive...
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Light fast great shoes very comparable to my kinvara but better
customer_reviews.author: Thomas  J  Fisher

customer_reviews.title: don't believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: active runner for 20+ years here. i read a lot of reviews before purchasing. but sadly, these shoes are the cheapest i've ever worn. bottom material just seems like cheap styrofoam. and shoes wear out incredibly fast. basically no stability support, which doesn't sound like a big deal until you actually experience it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A Timms

customer_reviews.title: Feels fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light shoe that feels fast and forces you into a mid sole strike. Good for 5ks and track workouts but not long runs.
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: So fast
customer_reviews.text: So out the box best shoes i have ran In Saucony , nike are my normal running shoes so comfortable and fast with no effort luv these shoes they run a little small though I’m a 10 1/2 will get 11 1/2 next time.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Insane speedwork shoe
customer_reviews.text: INSANE PERFORMANCE SHOE FOR SPEEDWORK. Got blisters the first day on both heels so make sure to wear socks that dont fall down. The midsole/toe sole of the shoe props you up perfectly and feels like a spike plated flat but the cushioning is bouncy.
customer_reviews.author: Brayden

customer_reviews.title: Husband LOVES them
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my husband. He has yet to run in them but says they are comfortable and true to an old pair of Skechers he still has. The colors and design are really eye-catching too...
customer_reviews.author: Countrygirlforever

customer_reviews.title: Speed demons
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and fast. Seem well made and durable. Can’t wait to ru the Boston Marathon this year in them.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Bechard

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for tempo runs
customer_reviews.text: Solid support and padded sole comes with a bare minimum extra weight. Wore them on a longer trial run (15 miles) and loved everything so far. Loved extra padding on the back of the heels. It remains to be seen how my new Razors fare after 200-300 miles -- some of my recent experience with other Skechers racers was not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Hedgehog

customer_reviews.title: Light, Durable, Fast
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely impressed with these shoes! They are quite light, the foam sole is quite durable, and feel fast during training runs.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Gee

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: First time user and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ester Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and cushioned. I use them for speed workouts and 5K-10K races. Probably not enough support for longer races.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get a chance to wear it too much. Took it out for a quick 5 miler and felt pretty good. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Phanit Pollavith

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love them!!! Light, comfortable and great price!! Very happy
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: lite weight!!!!
customer_reviews.text: laces. I'll keep using the current laces for a few more runs but might switch them out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the Brand and the Look: this is the second best running shoe on the market in early 2019.
customer_reviews.text: Don't feel like shelling out $250 for Vaporflys, but want a serious running shoe? This is it. The Hyperburst midsole is LEGIT. Springy, sister material of Zoom X (both Pebax, both lighter and springier than Boost). -Some of you will thumb your nose at the Skechers brand. -Some of you will be put off by the graphics of this shoe (I happen to think it is kinda retro-cool) -Some of you will therefore miss out on an incredible... INCREDIBLE shoe. 6oz at that amount of cushion and energy return seriously makes other shoes seem like a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: The Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe so far!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe for training and recovery. Has a nice snug sock-like feel. Super light. Feels light enough to wear as a race day. Hyper foam feels great. At first glance it looks like a thick packing foam... but so far its held up no problem. Skechers Performance line has a new fan. Went with the next size up. I'm typically a 9.5 in Asics and On Running shoes. 10 in Saucony and now Skechers.
customer_reviews.author: John Waldron

customer_reviews.title: MOTORCYCLE TIRES RUBBER FOR THE BOTTOM OF THE RUNNING SHOES; RUBBER RUNNING SHOE TREADS ASAP
customer_reviews.text: I NEED A SHOE THAT HAS MOTORCYCLE TIRE RUBBER ON THE BOTTOM OF THE SHOE; RUBBER RUNNING SHOE TREADS WOULD BE GREAT ON THIS SHOE STYLE ESPECIALLY THICK RUBBER SOLES IN THE FRONT AND THE BACK OF THE SHOE USING A RUBBER STRIP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE BOTTOM OF THE SHOE TO CREATE A RUBBER SPRING WHICH USES INERTIA IN YOUR INSTEP TO LIFT THE FOOT AND HELP SPRING FORWARD WITH FASTER SPEED ON FOOT RUNNING; RUBBER SPRING ACTION INSOLE WITH A RUBBER SOLE IN THE COLOR BLACK.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Craft

customer_reviews.title: A Great and Cushy runner
customer_reviews.text: Truly an exceptional shoe for shock absorption. The sole is slightly rounded so you roll your foot heel to toe as you run. Nothing drastic. But the cushioning of the sole material is amazing. And so light for a thick healed runner but still way flexable. If I had to find one slight imperfection it’s that the way cushy and rounded sole makes things slightly, very slightly, wobbly from a pro/supinate standpoint. but I’m reaching here
customer_reviews.author: JM

product_meta.title: Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper Running Shoes - SS20
product_meta.description: Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper Running Shoes The Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper is a versatile, lightweight fast trainer/race day shoe. Ripstop Mesh Upper Designed to be lightweight and supportive, the Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper Running Shoes feature a translucent mesh upper. The translucent mesh allows cool air to permeate throughout the entire upper to increase ventilation and to reduce an uncomfortable heat build-up; creating a perfect environment for your feet to thrive in. Perforations within the fabric increase airflow allowing you to remain cool, dry and comfortable at all times. As well as this, the upper is also highly durable and has been constructed using ripstop to reduce the risks of abrasion. The ripstop mesh reduces wear and tear to increase overall durability and gives you a long-lasting running buddy. The upper has been constructed using a seamless, non-stretch upper which reduces the risks of chafing and irritation so you can go further for longer in complete comfort. A moulded heel counter ensures a stable and secure fit whilst 3D printed upper graphics support the foot to ensure a comfortable and secure fit. Completing the upper is a pressure-reducing lacing system which locks down the midfoot whilst still providing a comfortable fit. The lace-up front with nearly weightless reinforced eyelet secures the midfoot to reduce in-shoe slippage so you can enjoy distraction-free strides. Hyper Burst Midsole Light, responsive and comfortable, Skechers have used their signature HyperBust midsole technology in the Skechers GOrun Razor 3 Hyper Running Shoes. This highly responsive, ultralightweight and long-lasting midsole compound provides ample cushioning and has excellent rebound properties that propel you on race day. The midsole works to actively and efficiently absorb shocks before they can reach the sole of the foot, this reduces potential injury and you strike down on unforgiving terrain. As well as preventing impacts from reaching the fo
feature_bullets: Runner's World Gear of the Year Award Winner

UPPER: Durable translucent ripstop mesh upper ensures support and breathability. Seamless non-stretch upper for added comfort. Molded heel counter for a stable and secure fit. Pressure-reducing speed lacing system. 3D printed upper graphics.

MIDSOLE: HYPER BURST is a new midsole foam created using a 'Super Critical ' process. The process creates an extremely lightweight and resilient material for long wearing durability and responsiveness.
OUTSOLE: Strategically-placed rubber outsole provides durability and traction. Mid-foot strike zone promotes efficiency in each stride.
Stack Height: 23mm Forefoot, 27mm Heel. Offset Height: 4mm. Weight: Radically lightweight 6. 4 oz. in a men's size 9.
